question.questionA: Dwarf  shrub  with  spiny  branched  stems;  leaves  pinnatifid,  fleshy; capitula pale yellow.
question.questionB: Herbaceous plants.

question.questionA: Stoloniferous perennials, forming globular underground tubers, with black stalked glands at the base of the involucre and the top of the stem.
question.questionB: Plants either not stoloniferous or not bearing globular  underground tubers.

question.questionA: Involucral  bracts linear-lanceolate, abruptly narrowed to an obtuse apex.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts linear, gradually tapering to an acute apex.

question.questionA: Pappus absent, or achene with a narrow membranous margin.
question.questionB: Pappus distinct, of scales or hairs.

question.questionA: Leaves spiny, pappus absent or with two to three bristles.
question.questionB: Leaves not spiny.

question.questionA: Stems broadly winged, wings continuous; corolla with black hairs on the outside; anthers dark brown.
question.questionB: Stems narrowly winged, wings interrupted; corolla glabrous; anthers yellow.

question.questionA: Mature achenes oblong or oval, erect.
question.questionB: Mature achenes linear, spreading in a star.

question.questionA: Pappus of scales.
question.questionB: Pappus of hairs.

question.questionA: Florets blue.
question.questionB: Florets yellow.

question.questionA: Involucral bracts scarious; silvery; scales of achene long.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts leafy, green; scales of achene very short.

question.questionA: Stems erect, leafy at base; involucral bracts not hardening in fruit.
question.questionB: Stems leafless or prostrate below; involucral bracts hardening in fruit.

question.questionA: Inner achenes not winged.
question.questionB: Inner achenes narrowly winged.

question.questionA: Scape procumbent,  as long as the leaves, conspicuously swollen below the  capitulum; involucral  bracts erect in fruit, florets scarcely longer  than the involucral bracts.
question.questionB: Scape erect, longer than the leaves, not swollen below the capitulum; involucral   bracts spreading in fruit, florets twice as long as the involucral bracts.

question.questionA: Hairs of pappus simple.
question.questionB: Hairs of pappus plumose.

question.questionA: Fruit of two forms:  the inner smooth or fine-pointed; the outer either rough or velvety, or with inner face keeled or convex.
question.questionB: Fruits all similar.

question.questionA: Marginal achenes keeled or winged on inner face.
question.questionB: Marginal achenes transversely wrinkled.

question.questionA: Capitula sessile, scapes apparently absent.
question.questionB: Capitula on branched or unbranched stems.

question.questionA: Leaves almost all radical, ovate-oblong, dentate, with yellowish hairs.
question.questionB: Cauline leaves frequent, deeply and irregularly pinnatifid.

question.questionA: Heads drooping or inclined in bud; marginal  achenes short-beaked, clasped by the inner involucral bracts; central achenes long-beaked.
question.questionB: Heads erect in bud; all achenes long-beaked.

question.questionA: Leaves pinnatifid with rounded lobes; involucral bracts cordate with broad scarious margins; ligules yellow, purple at the base.
question.questionB: Leaves irregularly serrate; involucral bracts cordate with narrow scarious margins; ligules yellow, yellow at the base.

question.questionA: Achene beaked.
question.questionB: Achene without a beak.

question.questionA: Beak of achene with a tiny crown of scales at the base.
question.questionB: Beak of achene without a tiny crown of scales at the base.

question.questionA: All leaves radical.
question.questionB: Cauline leaves present.

question.questionA: Achene cylindrical, angled, not flattened.
question.questionB: Achene laterally compressed.

question.questionA: Florets yellow; leaves ovate-sagittate with prickly margins
question.questionB: Florets lilac; leaves linear or lanceolate, margins without prickles.

question.questionA: Capitula with five florets; cauline leaves linear with adpressed auricles.
question.questionB: Capitula with twelve to twenty florets; cauline leaves lanceolate with spreading auricles.

question.questionA: Achenes laterally compressed.
question.questionB: Achenes round or angled in section.

question.questionA: Bases of cauline leaves wrapped around the stem; capitula orange.
question.questionB: Bases of cauline leaves not wrapped around the stem; capitula yellow.

question.questionA: Cauline leaves pinnatisect, usually without teeth.
question.questionB: Cauline leaves simple, dentate.

question.questionA: Leaves shining; achenes strongly compressed, often winged,  smooth between the ribs.
question.questionB: Leaves not shining; achenes not strongly compressed, wingless, ridged or tuberculate between the ribs.

question.questionA: Receptacle  with  pits,  surrounded  by  hairs  at  least as long as the achenes.
question.questionB: Receptacle without pits surrounded by hairs.

question.questionA: Achenes gradually narrowed to the apex; involucre usually of  bracts of equal length; pappus snowy-white, soft.
question.questionB: Achenes abruptly narrowed to the  apex;  involucre  usually  of many rows of unequal bracts; pappus pale brown, brittle.

question.questionA: Receptacle with narrow, linear  scales;  scape  leafless  or with few leaves.
question.questionB: Receptacle without scales.

question.questionA: Involucral bracts in one row, not overlapping.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts in two rows or overlapping.

question.questionA: Leaves entire.
question.questionB: Leaves dentate.

question.questionA: Ligules violet-purple, little shorter  than  the involucral  bracts; apex of the beak surrounded by an annulus which separates it from the pappus.
question.questionB: Ligules reddish-lilac, distinctly shorter than the involucral bracts; beak of achenes without a ring; outer achenes with a pappus of five unequal stiff hairs, inner achenes a pappus of plumose hairs.

question.questionA: Leaves hispid; ligules pale yellow, with black teeth at the end, outer ligules often reddish at the back.
question.questionB: Leaves prickly, at least below the veins; ligules deep yellow, without black teeth, outer ligules yellow at the back.

question.questionA: Capitula with an involucre of three to five upper leaves.
question.questionB: Capitula without an involucre of leaves.

question.questionA: Involucral  bracts triangular-ovate to broadly lanceolate; pappus hairs often intertwined.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts linear; pappus hairs not intertwined.

question.questionA: Perennials with root tubers; involucral bracts glabrous or with hairs often confined to the mid-line;  achenes minutely transversely ridged, the outer curved not beaked with a pappus of very short hairs, the inner straight with a pappus of long plumose hairs on a long beak.
question.questionB: Perennials without root tubers; involucral bracts hairy all over; outer achenes not beaked, with a pappus of short scales, the inner with a pappus of hairs on a short beak.
